column4: i'm on an older pc, and ubuntu is a bit slow. how can i make it faster?
for example can i reduce the eye-candy and effects of gnome to make it more lightweight?

gnome is never going to be light weight. xfce is only alternative for that. gnome pulls in all kinds of stuff to do simple things. it constanly borrows existing progs and loads em instead of something coded from scratch if that makes any sense
i mention xfce becaulse of gtk
is there a gnome control panel?
you can run gnome-panel from xfce or fluxbox for that matter if you want. you can even just start x with nothing but a windows and run gnome-panel. but gnome apps will be bloated
open a terminal and type 'pkill gnome-panel'
is there a thing like gnome control center?
yeah. do a apt-get install xubuntu-desktop  you can choose between xfce and gnome at the login screen by clicking 'sessions' button
by default the de for xubuntu looks pretty lame but can be setup to look as cool as any other
how can i test my download speed?
no i meant like a center that would allow me to reduce font quality and the rest
